item.title: BBS
item.description: /c/BBS on lemmy.sdf.org [home] [/c/bbs 🌎] [lemmy.sdf.org] Description The place where Bulletin Board Systems live on! --- **Post / Comment Guidelines** - Don't Spam. - Don't be a jerk. - Read the FAQ (TODO :)) when it's ready. --- Reminisce with [The BBS Documentary](http://www.bbsdocumentary.com/), viewable online [here](http://archive.org/details/BBS.The.Documentary). --- Find one of hundreds of BBSes running **today** using the lists found at [The Telnet BBS Guide](http://www.telnetbbsguide.com/), [BBS Guide](http://bbs.guide/), or [IPTIA BBS Resource Site](https://www.

item.title: Bonsai Plant Discussion
item.description: /c/Bonsai Plant Discussion on lemmy.sdf.org [home] [/c/bonsai 🌎] [lemmy.sdf.org] Description A community for discussing the practice of growing bonsai plants. Bonsai here is a blanket term, not limited to the Japanese tradition of bonsai, but also including all Asian arts pertaining to diminutive potted plants. item.title: Hello World!
item.description: /c/Hello World! on lemmy.sdf.org [home] [/c/helloworld 🌎] [lemmy.sdf.org] Description Got a new thing you want to share? Announce it here. We'd love to hear about it. Some Guidelines: 1. When in doubt, assume the poster posted with the best intentions. Language is hard. Communication is harder. 2. Don't be an asshole. Constructive criticism is fine. But seriously, if you can't say something nice: go somewhere else. 3. NSFW content is fine, but please mark it as such.

item.title: Mac Gaming
item.description: /c/Mac Gaming on lemmy.sdf.org [home] [/c/macgaming 🌎] [lemmy.sdf.org] Description Welcome to the Mac Gaming Community! This is a place for all Mac gamers to discuss, share, and enjoy the world of gaming on macOS. Whether you're a casual player or a dedicated enthusiast, we welcome you to join our community and share your passion for Mac gaming! Rules Be respectful and civil. Treat others how you'd like to be treated. Personal attacks, harassment, and hate speech will not be tolerated.

item.title: DND Memes
item.description: /c/DND Memes on lemmy.sdf.org [home] [/c/dndmemes 🌎] [lemmy.sdf.org] Description For memes related to DND. Current Rules: 1) Don't be a jerk. 2) Must be a meme related to Dungeons and Dragons and/or TTRPG in a relatable context. 3) Be civil. Just because you do not agree with an opinion expressed in a meme does not mean that you have to attempt to blast the OP down in a personal manner. See rule 1.

item.title: Living in vans, cars, RVs, etc
item.description: /c/Living in vans, cars, RVs, etc on lemmy.sdf.org [home] [/c/houseless 🌎] [lemmy.sdf.org] Description We're not homeless, we're houseless! By choice or by circumstance we are living in our vehicles. Don't worry about us -- it can be a very good life. Anything that affects us _as vehicle-dwellers_ is probably on topic. # external resources - [emergency guide to suddenly living in a vehicle](https://rvwiki.mousetrap.net/doku.php?id=lifestyle:involuntary) <-- start here if you don't have a choice in the matter

item.title: retro NET - Vintage Sites/Fads/Software/Games/Memes
item.description: /c/retro NET - Vintage Sites/Fads/Software/Games/Memes on lemmy.sdf.org [home] [/c/retronet 🌎] [lemmy.sdf.org] Description Community for discussing internet and software topics that are 20+ years old. Topics can be sites/fads/software/games/memes or any general happenings that used to occur on computers way back in the day. Submission Guidelines: 1) Topic of discussion should have originated 20+ years ago. A topic (such as a fad or web game) that originated 20 years ago but remained popular for a couple years is ok, as long as it first began 20+ years ago.
